result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J. Brudnowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $500 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars other than as required for employment, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any further violent and/or confrontational contact with K. Brudnowski.

Defendant to complete a Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.  DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 2.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J. Brudnowski

defendant.name: Brudnowski, Anthony J.
defendant.address: N752 Spring Lake Est Dr, Neshkoro, WI 54960

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 10:48 AM:  Defendant Anthony J. Brudnowski in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agent Jannisa Koch from DOC also present in court.   Per correspondence received from DOC, Def does not have access to required programming ordered.  Court is concerned this matter was just brought to the Court's attention just prior to expiration of supervision - 2 wks prior.  Statement by ADA:  Options are available in neighboring counties - i.e., Winnebago.  The hope from the State is that DAAP treatment would still take place in light of convictions.  Statement by Agent Koch - speaks that Green Lake terminated their programming 6-7 yrs ago. Winnebago clients are referred to Lutheran Social Services - not technically a DAAP program.  Explains therapy provided during supervision.  Specific Anger Mgmnt treatment not completed - some completed thru therapist.  Statement by Defendant.  Previous joint venture has been sold and has solved the underlying problems.  Extreme financial situation have been somewhat resolved and continuing on supervision would add to the financial hardship.  Local DAAP was lost in this county approx over 1 yr ago.  Further statement by Def - previous agent was supposed to address this problem with the Court and that was not taken care of before she left. Def also has had 2 temporary agents before being assigned with Agent Koch.  Single violation reported on by Agent Koch while on supervision.  Court questions Agent as to the loss of this DAAP service.  Agents continue to receive training on utilization of DAAP tools and this gap may be filled locally by providing oversight with an educational and therapeutic model within.  This protocol with a change journal was completed by Def - compliance with assignments and project was accomplished in full in January 2017.  Agent feels Def has made progress during supervision and its a hardship to complete DAAP with the unavailability.  Further statement by Def as to treatment completed with DHS on AODA issues.  Successful goals completed thru AODA as per discharge report.  The Court:  Upset with prior agent that this problem of unavailability was not brought forth for the Court to address sooner.  Court is saddened by the loss of this programming due to its prior involvement and being instrumental in setting up this programming almost 20 yrs ago.  Takes note of progress made with the tools available.  Understands the financial hardships that exist within the household.  Court makes the determination that components of supervision have been complied with.  Expects that Def will be successfully discharged from supervision on the expected date.  Very little would be accomplished with any extension of supervision.
Probation review hearing on March 23, 2017 at 10:45 am.
Letter from DA Blader in response to DOC request -  - the Court will set a hearing to address this issue
from DOC requesting an amendment to the JOC to state that the DE must complete any assessments and treatment as requested by the DOC as Waushara Co does not have a certified DAAP

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony J. Brudnowski
Current: N752 Spring Lake Est Dr, Neshkoro, WI 54960 United States  (Effective: 10-16-2015)
Prior: 204 S Main St, Neshkoro, WI 54960
JOC returned by USPS - No mail receptacle - Unable to Forward

Case called @ 2:13 p.m. Defendant Anthony J. Brudnowski in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 2 & 3 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 1 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W - 18 mos probation as to each count concurrent - Conditions: DAAP and follow through, AODA and follow through,  defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars other than as required for employment, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, N/C/C w/ K. Brudnowski, DNA sample and surcharge, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Bond previously posted to be applied. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-28-2015 02:00 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-15-2015 10:30 am

P/S Scheduled as per counsel's request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Status conference at 07-07-2015 09:05 am

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney David C. Rashid in court, appearing via telephone.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Rashid - still reviewing discovery and offer extended.  STC rescheduled as per request.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 09:05 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars with the exception of Bees Club 73, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 3:29 p.m. Defendant Anthony J. Brudnowski in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP entered as to all counts.  Motion by Atty Rashid to have the no contact condition of bond be modified to no violent or confrontational contact with the victim. Statement by ADA Anderson - no objection to an amendment of the bond. The court will amend the bond to reflect no violent or confrontational contact with K. B.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance at 04-27-2015 03:15 pm

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:15 p.m. Defendant Anthony J. Brudnowski in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be privately retaining counsel - was eligible for SPD services and declined. ADA Anderson requesting $500 Cash Bond. Statement by DE regarding bond - requesting signature bond. NG plea entered. Court orders $500 Cash Bond.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
